meanings.definition: A system of channels or pathways designed to protect and organize electrical wires.
meanings.sent1: The wireways in the building keep all the electrical wires safe and neat.
meanings.sent2: The electrician installed wireways to ensure the wires were organized.
meanings.sent3: The wireways decided to have a race to see who could carry the most wires!
meanings.sent4: The wireways of communication between the two countries were crucial for diplomacy.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow wireways stood out against the dark walls, making them easy to spot.

meanings.definition: The act of installing or maintaining wireways.
meanings.sent1: Proper wireways installation is essential for electrical safety.
meanings.sent2: The electrician's job involved a lot of wireways work.
meanings.sent3: The wireways maintenance crew always had their hands full with repairs.
meanings.sent4: She approached her work with the precision of a wireways technician.
meanings.sent5: The art of wireways upkeep required attention to detail and skill.

meanings.definition: A specific type of wireway used in industrial settings.
meanings.sent1: The industrial wireways were designed to withstand heavy machinery vibrations.
meanings.sent2: Workers in the factory relied on the specialized industrial wireways.
meanings.sent3: The wireways for factories were known for their durability and efficiency.
meanings.sent4: The industrial wireways hummed with the energy of production.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the industrial wireways impressed even the most experienced engineers.
